text: hi I'm Katherine from Langcheng today
I'll give a 4-minute tour of the
Lingraph platform our commercial
offering for developing deploying and
managing agent tech applications
lingraph platform works well with our
Lingraph open source framework but it is
framework agnostic designed to work with
any agent framework as a centralized
platform for agents in the enterprise
let's dive in first let's see how
Lingraph platform can help with the
speed of development developers can
create and use templates from existing
deployments allowing you to adapt
existing code as a starting point for
development once our agent is ready
deploying is as simple as one click you
can select a GitHub project hit submit
and the Lang takes care of the rest
once your deployment is spun you'll have
flexible API endpoints that support
features such as memory chronoprops
along with a whole suite of
functionalities that enable agent UX
some compelling experiences that your
agent will support out of the box are
streaming back intermediary steps to
show its work while it's happening and
human in the loop supervision allowing
end users to review approve or intervene
when needed
langraph platform's comprehensive API
saves teams time allowing to ship faster
with less effort every deployment also
comes with Langraph Studio so you can
debug interact with and visualize your
agent run watch as we send a request to
agent
the studio allows developers to see how
the agent arrives at its final decision
providing insight into challenges or
area to
improve lastly Langrath platform helps
enterprises manage the proliferation of
agents so that agents can be easily
discovered and reused all while adhering
to enterprise access best
practices the agent registry provides a
centralized view of all deployed agents
here any authorized member is able to
see which agents are available for use
either to leverage directly or to
adapt for any deployed agent lingra
platform allows you to leverage other
deployed applications as reusable
building blocks for example our
developer productivity agent reuses a
code testing agent that my teammate has
deployed through the remote graph
feature treating it as if it were
running locally
alternatively you can adapt this code
agent by providing it with different
contexts through the Langra platform
assistance it allows you to configure
elements of the agent such as the prompt
or the model name directly from the
UI finally every deployment
automatically creates a tracing project
in
Linksmith where you can review traces
iterate on prompts or add traces to data
sets as a foundation for test suites
with Langraph platform you can rapidly
build deploy and manage agents all one
place
